Key Match Events: The Kings controlled this entire game and that started with their control of the tempo.
DeMar DeRozan gave 20 points on 9-14 from the field, he also dished out eight assists.
DeRozan’s precision and dedication to his craft brings a new dimension to this Kings offense that allows his teammates to be the best versions of themselves.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts were nervous going into the game due to past trends of yesteryear’s back to backs.
Coach Mike Brown found an 8-man rotation that felt comfortable, dynamic, and seamless.
Post-Match Reflections: I am still getting used to the fact that DeMar DeRozan is actually here.
DeRozan’s precision and dedication to his craft brings a new dimension to this Kings offense that allows his teammates to be the best versions of themselves.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings finished their first back to back of the week strong with a demonstrative win in Utah.
The Kings held their opponents under 100 points for the second straight game.
De’Aaron Fox has been doing a terrific job of distributing this season.
Others: The Kings’ controlled tempo allowed them to shoot just two free throws the entire first half.
The Kings held on to their 20-point lead and made their way to the stripe 12 more times in the second half.
